Package infodynamics.measures.continuous.kernel

Class MultiInfoCalculatorKernel

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.MultiInfoCalculatorCommon
      • infodynamics.measures.continuous.kernel.MultiInfoCalculatorKernel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous, MultiInfoCalculator
    public class MultiInfoCalculatorKernel
extends MultiInfoCalculatorCommon

    Computes the differential multi-information of a given multivariate set of observations (implementing MultiInfoCalculator), using box-kernel estimation. For details on box-kernel estimation, see Kantz and Schreiber (below).

    Usage is as per the paradigm outlined for MultiInfoCalculator, with:

    • The constructor step being a simple call to MultiInfoCalculatorKernel().
    • Further properties are available, see setProperty(String, String);
    • An additional initialise(int, double) option;
    • Additional utility methods for computing other information-theoretic values are available here (e.g. computeAverageJointEntropy()) which can be called after all observations are supplied.

    TODO Use only a single kernel estimator class for the joint space, and compute other probabilities from this. This will save much time.

    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)
    See Also:
    "H. Kantz and T. Schreiber, 'Nonlinear Time Series Analysis'. Cambridge, MA: Cambridge University Press, 1997"

      • initialise

        public void initialise​(int dimensions,
                       double epsilon)
        Initialise the calculator for (re-)use, with a specific kernel width and with number of joint variables specified, and existing (or default) values of other parameters,. Clears an PDFs of previously supplied observations.
        Parameters:
        dimensions - the number of joint variables
        kernelWidth - if MultiInfoCalculator.PROP_NORMALISE property has been set, then this kernel width corresponds to the number of standard deviations from the mean (otherwise it is an absolute value)

      • setProperty

        public void setProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName,
                        java.lang.String propertyValue)
                 throws java.lang.Exception

        Set properties for the kernel multi-information calculator. New property values are not guaranteed to take effect until the next call to an initialise method.

        Valid property names, and what their values should represent, include:

        • KERNEL_WIDTH_PROP_NAME (legacy value is EPSILON_PROP_NAME) -- kernel width to be used in the calculation. If MultiInfoCalculatorCommon.normalise is set, then this is a number of standard deviations; otherwise it is an absolute value. Default is DEFAULT_KERNEL_WIDTH.
        • DYN_CORR_EXCL_TIME_NAME -- a dynamics exclusion time window (see Kantz and Schreiber), default is 0 which means no dynamic exclusion window.
        • any valid properties for MultiInfoCalculatorCommon.setProperty(String, String).

        Note that dynamic correlation exclusion (set with DYN_CORR_EXCL_TIME_NAME) may have unexpected results if multiple observation sets have been added. This is because multiple observation sets are treated as though they are from a single time series, so observations from near the end of observation set i will be excluded from comparison to observations near the beginning of observation set (i+1).

        Unknown property values are ignored.

        Specified by:
        setProperty in interface InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Specified by:
        setProperty in interface MultiInfoCalculator
        Overrides:
        setProperty in class MultiInfoCalculatorCommon
        Parameters:
        propertyName - name of the property
        propertyValue - value of the property
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for invalid property values

        Description copied from interface: InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Get current property values for the calculator.

      • computeLocalOfPreviousObservations

        public double[] computeLocalOfPreviousObservations()
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: MultiInfoCalculator

        Computes the local values of the multi-information, for each valid observation in the previously supplied observations (with PDFs computed using all of the previously supplied observation sets).

        If the samples were supplied via a single call i.e. MultiInfoCalculator.setObservations(double[][]), then the return value is a single time-series of local channel measure values corresponding to these samples.

        Otherwise where disjoint time-series observations were supplied using several calls such as MultiInfoCalculator.addObservations(double[][]) then the local values for each disjoint observation set will be appended here to create a single "time-series" return array.

        Returns:
        the "time-series" of local multi-information values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations

        public double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations​(double[][] states)
        Compute the local multi-information values for each of the supplied samples in states.

        PDFs are computed using all of the previously supplied observations, but not those in states (unless they were some of the previously supplied samples).

        Note that calls to this method will not harness dynamic correlation exclusion (if set) since we don't know whether it's the same time set or not.

        Parameters:
        states - series of multivariate observations (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number)
        Returns:
        the series of local multi-information values.

      • computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations

        protected double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations​(double[][] states,
                                                         boolean isOurPreviousObservations)
        Internal implementation for computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[][]) and computeLocalOfPreviousObservations().
        Parameters:
        states - series of multivariate observations (first index is time or observation index, second is variable number)
        isOurPreviousObservations - true if we are implementing computeLocalOfPreviousObservations(), false for computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[][])
        Returns:
        the series of local multi-information values.

      • computeLocalJointEntropyUsingPreviousObservations

        public double[] computeLocalJointEntropyUsingPreviousObservations​(double[][] states)
        Compute the local joint entropy values for these given values, using the previously provided observations to compute the probabilities. Calls to this method will not harness dynamic correlation exclusion (if set) since we don't know whether it's the same time set or not.
        Parameters:
        states1 - provided source observations
        states2 - provided destination observations
        Returns:
        the local joint entropies in bits

Calls to this method will not harness dynamic correlation exclusion (if set) since we don't know whether it's the same time set or not.
